apiInfo.title: Fulqrom Hub REST API
apiInfo.description: Australian Commercial Real Estate & HVAC Building Management System API

Primary contact object

response.data: Array of filtered contact objects

get.description: Get hierarchical structure for customer (sites > buildings > floors > assets)

queryParams.building_id: Filter by specific building ID - returns building-level hierarchy only
queryParams.floor_number: Filter by floor number within a building (requires building_id) - returns floor-level hierarchy
queryParams.floor_level: Filter by exact floor level string (e.g., 'Lvl 20', 'GF') within a building (requires building_id) - returns floor-level hierarchy

response.data: Array of hierarchical nodes (sites/buildings with nested floors and assets)

metadata.level: string (only present when floor_level filtering is used)

buildingStructure.building_grade: string (Grade A, Grade B, Grade C, Premium)

floorStructure.floor_type: string (Office, Retail, Plant Room, Lab, Common Area, Residential)

notes.apiVersion: This API reference reflects the current implementation as of 2025-09-27
notes.routePrefix: All API routes are prefixed with '/api/'
notes.tenantRouteDiscrepancy: Tenant routes use '/api/building-tenants' in server.js but model collection is 'building_tenants'
notes.populatedFields: Most GET requests populate referenced fields for better data context
notes.summaryStats: List endpoints include calculated summary statistics where applicable
notes.virtualFields: Models include virtual fields for computed values (formatted dates, display names, etc.)
notes.textSearch: Documents collection supports full-text search on title, description, and tags
notes.aggregationSupport: Statistics endpoints use MongoDB aggregation for efficient data processing
notes.validationStrategy: Comprehensive validation on API level with minimal frontend validation
notes.errorHandling: Consistent error response format across all endpoints
notes.securityFeatures: CORS configured, helmet for security headers, input sanitization
notes.hierarchyApi: New hierarchy API provides nested site > building > floor > asset structure with building-level and floor-level filtering
notes.buildingEnumRemoval: Building type and status enum restrictions removed to allow flexible values
notes.assetBuildingLink: Assets now include building_id field for proper building-level hierarchy filtering
notes.floorModelEnhanced: Floor model updated with comprehensive field set including assets_count, dual area systems, occupancy tracking, and metadata support
notes.floorBackwardCompatibility: Floor model maintains backward compatibility with both old (area_number, area_unit) and new (floor_area, floor_area_unit) field naming
notes.floorLevelFiltering: Hierarchy API supports floor_level filtering by exact string match (e.g., 'Lvl 20', 'GF') for precise asset filtering within buildings
notes.searchFunctionality: Search functionality implemented across all customer module GET endpoints: Sites, Buildings, Floors, Tenants, Documents, and Contacts. Simple case-insensitive partial matching across key fields using regex patterns
notes.searchImplementation: Search parameter added to main list endpoints with logical field selection: sites (site_name, address, manager.name), buildings (building_name, building_code), floors (floor_name), tenants (tenant_legal_name, tenant_trading_name, abn, primary_contact_name, primary_contact_email, industry_type), contacts (full_name, method_value, job_title, department, role_type)
notes.tenantsCollection: Added dedicated /api/tenants route separate from /api/building-tenants for simplified tenant management with search capability
notes.documentSearch: Documents collection has comprehensive search with helper functions covering name, description, tags, customer, location, file metadata, and compliance fields
notes.customerStats: Added customer statistics endpoint (/api/customers/:id/stats) that provides dynamic counts for sites, buildings, assets, and documents with proper nested field query for documents (customer.customer_id)
notes.contactManagement: Comprehensive contact management APIs implemented: full CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete), primary contact management, search functionality, and nested contact operations within customer entities. Contacts are managed as subdocuments in the customer's contact_methods array.
notes.multipleContactMethods: Enhanced contact system to support multiple contact methods per contact. Each contact can have multiple communication methods (Email, Phone, SMS, WhatsApp) with individual add/edit/delete operations. Only one primary method per contact is enforced. Includes backward compatibility with legacy single-method structure and dedicated API endpoints for method management (/:id/methods).
